page.title: 16WOOD PRESERVATION AYMESTREY
page.content: At{Beech-Croft}near Aymestrey is a {Tanalith}timber treatment plant, installed in 1973 and supplying timber to all parts of Britain and also to Australia. The method is known as the {Vacuum Pressure Impregnation System. The outer bark is first removed and the timber dried. It is then fed into a steel cylinder 40' long and 4'6'' diameter and a vacuum pump used to withdraw all air from the wood. A solution of{copper chrome arsenate}is then pumped in and a pressure of 180lbs per sq in applied until the timber has absorbed 176.66 litres of solution per cub metre. The whole process taking approximately 5 hours. The solution can never be removed from the wood and it gives a greatly increased useful lifespan to timber which will be used for indoor and outdoor building.
